definition: finger/to point at or to/to indicate or refer to/to depend on/to count on/(of hair) to stand on end
to (a place)/until (a time)/up to/to go/to arrive/(verb complement denoting completion or result of an action)

sentences.english: Read the directions and directly you will be directed in the right direction.
sentences.chinese: 看看指示牌，你将直接被指到正确的方向。

sentences.english: Nine fifty-two on the clock above the refrigerator.
sentences.chinese: 冰箱上的钟已指到九点五十二分。

sentences.english: It seemed a century, minute, finally means to 12.
sentences.chinese: 似乎过了一个世纪，分针终于指到了12。

sentences.english: Let’s not try it now, I'm afraid it’s gotten a little rusty.
sentences.chinese: 我们现在别试，恐怕时针指到10点了，有点生锈。

sentences.english: Listen to the tape and piont to the city.
sentences.chinese: 播放录音，让学生边听边指到对应城市。

definition: to approach/to get close to/to sneak up on/near to
request granted (formal usage in old document)/to aim (gun)
(idiom) no sooner said than done/before you know it
pinyin: shuo1 shi2 chi2 , na4 shi2 kuai4

definition: to rove around/to run around in circles/to walk back and forth
to make an about-turn/to reverse one's direction, policy, sequence etc/to turn things on their head
to detain/to hold back by force/to buckle/to hook
